name: ocp
description: UNIX port of the Open Cubic Player

repo.name: opencubicplayer
repo.description: Open Cubic Player (unix fork). Music visualizer for various tracked music formats (amiga modules, S3M, IT), chiptunes and other formats related to demoscene

readme.summary: Comprehensive file format documentation but lacks basic installation instructions, practical usage examples, and assumes significant prior knowledge.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions provided - README references binary installations on Linux via Repology but provides no compile-from-source steps, dependency requirements, or platform-specific setup guidance.

injection_risks.description: Potential command injection vulnerability in cfGetProfileString and cfSetProfileString functions, as they seem to directly use user-provided input without proper sanitization.
Use of sprintf function with user-controlled data in the format string, which could lead to a buffer overflow vulnerability.

critical_findings: Potential command injection vulnerability in configuration file parsing
Lack of input validation for command line arguments
security.summary: The code has several security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which could be exploited by an attacker to gain unauthorized access or execute malicious code.

common_complaints: File format compatibility issues (IT, S3M, MOD modules not playing correctly)
Audio playback bugs (SID files crashing, stereo samples downmixed to mono, low polyphony)
Configuration and UI confusions (keybinding conflicts, unclear settings navigation)
Application hangs and crashes during playback
Missing features (soundfont sidecar files, stereo sample support, external library options)
praise_themes: Appreciation for continued development and maintenance
Recognition as a valuable tool that influenced user platform choices
sentiment.summary: Active but struggling community with legitimate technical bugs in core audio playback functionality, moderate maintainer engagement, and user frustration centered on file format compatibility and application stability.

communication.summary: Responses are generally clear and helpful, showing a good level of technical depth and patience.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-11)
9 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicates no maintenance work
No merged PRs in past 6 months shows no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process may be stalled
positive_signals: Recent commit timestamp suggests repository still exists and was touched recently
maintenance.summary: The ocp package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for 6+ months despite a recent timestamp, accumulating unresolved issues with no active contributors or development.

project_metrics.description: Open Cubic Player (unix fork). Music visualizer for various tracked music formats (amiga modules, S3M, IT), chiptunes and other formats related to demoscene

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is detailed and comprehensive, but can be overwhelming for new users and lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Low number of contributors (only 1 active in the past 6 months)
No open PRs, indicating a lack of community contribution or interest
Docs: Lack of clear and concise installation instructions and troubleshooting section
Community: file format support and playback issues
Security: Potential command injection vulnerability in configuration file parsing
Security: Lack of input validation for command line arguments
High bus factor risk (95% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commits and releases within the last year
Moderate number of issues and PRs managed over the past 6 months
